intro: Echinocaulos, commonly known as the spiny bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and pods that contain small, round seeds. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Echinocaulos is an annual herb that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides food for certain wildlife species.
